modules.description: This module defines statistical operations for retrieving performance metrics, including mean, median, and standard deviation. It uses a polymorphic type `t` to represent statistical values and supports combining multiple statistics into tuples. These functions are used to analyze historical performance data retrieved via `get_previous_stats`.

This module provides operations for constructing and sending time-series data points to InfluxDB, as well as building and executing InfluxQL queries to retrieve and format stored data. It works with measurements, tags, fields, timestamps, and query components like aggregation functions, filtering clauses, and grouping logic. Specific use cases include tracking performance metrics over time, analyzing regression trends, and extracting structured results for visualization or alerting systems.

This module creates and updates Grafana dashboards by generating panels, graphs, and queries tailored for performance regression analysis. It works with InfluxDB queries, time intervals, and Grafana-specific structures like dashboards, panels, and y-axis configurations. Concrete use cases include building time-series graphs from InfluxDB data, organizing panels into dashboards, and visualizing performance metrics across different test runs.

This module enables registration and execution of long-running performance regression tests, focusing on statistical analysis of execution metrics like mean, median, and standard deviation. It integrates with InfluxDB to store and query historical time-series data, supports environment-specific test execution, and updates Grafana dashboards for real-time performance monitoring. Key use cases include detecting performance drifts across test runs, alerting on threshold breaches, and analyzing trends using statistical models.

This module computes statistical measures such as mean, median, and standard deviation from lists of floats. It operates directly on float lists to derive summary metrics. Use it to analyze numerical datasets for central tendency and dispersion, such as benchmark results or experimental data.

This module analyzes performance regression through statistical computations, time-series data storage, and visualization. It processes lists of numerical values for metrics like mean and standard deviation, stores and queries performance data in InfluxDB, and builds Grafana dashboards for trend visualization. Use it to detect performance changes across test runs, track metrics over time, and generate actionable insights from benchmark data.
